shows.title: Transforming Anxiety / Power of Herbs
shows.first_half: First Half: Prof. David H. Rosmarin will talk about how anxiety, one of the most common and misunderstood human emotions, can actually be a source of strength. He will share a four-step process to transform anxiety into a tool for growth, and explain how we can partner with it to perform better, and live more fully.
shows.second_half: Second Half: Sara Chana Silverstein is a master herbalist, homeopath, and author. Combining practical tips and ancient wisdom, she'll enlighten us on the power of herbs and roots, exploring how many herbs and root-rich foods can help us heal and strengthen our bodies in both hot and cold weather.

shows.title: Natural Remedies / Occult Teachings
shows.first_half: First Half: Pharmacist Ben Fuchs will discuss natural health remedies and the vitamins, nutrients, and minerals that our bodies need to maintain good health.
shows.second_half: Second Half: Author Carl Abrahamsson will speak about various aspects of magic and the occult, including world teachings, noted magicians, and what it means to have magic in today's world. He'll especially focus on the actions and lives of noted satanist Anton LaVey and occultist Aleister Crowley.

shows.title: Cosmology & the Mind / Halloween & Hoodoo
shows.first_half: First Half: UCSD Prof. Brian Keating will discuss how the universe and the human mind reveal their deepest secrets when we learn to focus. He'll share the mental frameworks that great scientists use to make sense of the cosmos, and research into the mysterious interstellar object known as 3I/ATLAS.
shows.second_half: Second Half: Miss Aida is an author, Hoodoo practitioner, and Conjure Woman. She'll delve into the Halloween holiday, its origins, spiritual significance, and the belief that during this time, the veil of the spiritual realm is thinned, allowing entities, both good and evil, to roam freely.

shows.title: GMO Update / Vampire & Supernatural Artifacts
shows.first_half: First Half: Author and consumer advocate Jeffrey Smith will discuss genetically modified foods (GMOs) in relation to health. He'll report how Congress is considering giving liability protection to Monsanto/Bayer and other pesticide companies, and reveal the shocking ways that he believes Monsanto defrauded the government, science, and consumers.
shows.second_half: Second Half: Author and museum curator Edmondo Crimi will talk about how art has been influenced by the battle between good and evil, and explore his museum of vampire art and paranormal activity, a venue that stimulates learning and understanding of the supernatural.

shows.title: Future of Technology / Open Lines
shows.first_half: Journalist Kevin Cirilli joins guest host Rich Berra (email) for a discussion on what it means for us to build a future that still feels human as we race to colonize Mars, deal with data becoming emotion, and handle the rise of AI that writes, learns, and dreams. Cirilli explores the intersection of space, technology, and consciousness, delving into the time when the story of our future shifts from being about machines to being about us. Followed by Open Lines in the latter half. Give Rich a call and discuss whatever is on your mind!
